title: Can't install on mac with StataIC
body:
I'm having trouble installing the kernel on my macbook pro (Catalina OS). I can run "pip install stata_kernel" successfully, though it does **not** generate a ".stata_kernel.conf" file. I created my own with the following content:

_[stata_kernel]
stata_path = /Applications/Stata/StataIC.app
execution_mode = automation_

Every time I run "python -m stata_kernel.install" I get the following message:

_Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 183, in _run_module_as_main
    mod_name, mod_spec, code = _get_module_details(mod_name, _Error)
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 109, in _get_module_details
    __import__(pkg_name)
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/stata_kernel/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from .kernel import StataKernel
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/stata_kernel/kernel.py", line 16, in <module>
    from .config import config
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/stata_kernel/config.py", line 171, in <module>
    config = Config()
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/stata_kernel/config.py", line 86, in __init__
    self.raise_config_error('stata_path')
  File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/stata_kernel/config.py", line 161, in raise_config_error
    raise ValueError(dedent(msg))
ValueError: stata_path option in configuration file is missing or invalid
Refer to the documentation to see how to set it manually:

https://kylebarron.dev/stata_kernel/using_stata_kernel/configuration/_


I'm obviously not good at this, so I'm maybe making a simple mistake?
